title: Brake Fluid Level Inspection

body.body: Warning - General - Stabilise Motorcycle - including DO NOT support on non integral parts
Make sure the motorcycle is stabilised and adequately supported.
Do not support the motorcycle on any ancillary component, the exhaust system or any other non structural parts of the motorcycle frame.
A correctly supported motorcycle will help prevent it from falling.
Failure to follow the advice above could result in serious injury or death.
In accordance with the Scheduled Maintenance chart, inspect the brake fluid level in the front and rear master cylinder reservoirs.
Front Brake Fluid level DR5; DS5
The brake fluid level must be kept between the upper and lower level lines with the motorcycle on its side stand and the steering on full right lock.
Front brake fluid level adjustment DR5; DS5
Remove the reservoir cap and the diaphragm seal.
Fill the reservoir to the upper level line using new DOT 4 fluid from a sealed container.
Install the fixings into the cap and diaphragm seal assembly.
Hold the assembly together and position the insert, cap, diaphragm seal and fixings onto the reservoir.
Reservoir cap, diaphragm seal and fixing assembly
If the master cylinder reservoir cap screws are over tightened this can result in a brake fluid leak.
A dangerous riding condition leading to loss of motorcycle control and an accident could result if this warning is ignored.

body.body: Front master cylinder reservoir cap screws
Rear brake fluid reservoir DR5; DS5
The reservoir fluid level lines are visible on the right hand side of the motorcycle on the front sprocket cover.
The brake fluid level must be kept between the upper and lower level lines (reservoir held horizontal).
Rear brake fluid reservoir adjustment DR5; DS5
Release the fixings and remove the front sprocket outer cover.
The fixing securing the front sprocket middle cover also secures the brake fluid reservoir to the sprocket cover.
Release the fixing and remove the front sprocket middle cover. Discard the fixing.
Detach the brake fluid reservoir from the sprocket cover.
Release the cap screws and remove the reservoir cover noting the position of the sealing diaphragm.
Fill the reservoir to the upper level line using new DOT 4 fluid from a sealed container.
